cetus.analysis
Class LoopTools

java.lang.Object
  cetus.analysis.LoopTools

public class LoopTools
extends java.lang.Object

Provides tools for querying information related to For Loop objects

isPrivate

public static boolean isPrivate(Symbol s,
                                Loop l)
Check if the input symbol is marked as private to the loop by the Privatization pass. ArrayPrivatization MUST be run before using this test

Parameters:
s - the symbol which needs to be checked as private to loop or not
l - the loop with respect to which private property needs to be checked
Returns:
true if private, else false

isReduction

public static boolean isReduction(Symbol s,
                                  Loop l)
Check if the input symbol is marked as reduction for the loop by the Reduction pass. Reduction Analysis MUST be run before using this test

Parameters:
s - the symbol which needs to be checked as reduction variable or not
l - the loop with respect to which reduction property needs to be checked
Returns:
true if reduction variable, else false

checkDataDependenceEligibility

public static boolean checkDataDependenceEligibility(Loop loop)
Checks the eligibility of a certain loop for data dependence testing Eligibility checks can be added or removed to increase the scope of dependence testing

Parameters:
loop -
Returns:
true if the loop is formed well enough to be eligible.

isIncrementEligible

public static boolean isIncrementEligible(Loop loop)
Returns true if the loop increment is an integer constant value. If symbolic, uses range information to determine if it is an integer constant value or not

Parameters:
loop - the loop whose increment needs to be checked
Returns:
true if increment is an integer constant value

getLoopIndexSymbol

public static Symbol getLoopIndexSymbol(Loop loop)
Get symbol of loop index, index variable is identified from step expression for loop

Returns:
Symbol for the loop index variable

replaceSymbolicLowerBound

public static Expression replaceSymbolicLowerBound(Loop loop,
                                                   RangeDomain loop_rd)
Replaces symbolic values in loop lower bound with information obtained from range analysis. If symbolic bound has a constant value, that value is the new lower bound. In case of a range expression, the lowerbound of the range is conservatively used as the lowerbound for the loop. If the symbolic value has an indeterminate value, the minimum possible value for Long is assigned to the lower bound

Parameters:
loop - the loop whose symbolic lower bound is to be replaced
loop_rd - the range domain representing ranges for all vars in the loop statement
Returns:
the expression for the new lowerbound with constant value

replaceSymbolicLowerBound

public static Expression replaceSymbolicLowerBound(Loop loop)
Replaces symbolic values in loop lower bound with information obtained from range analysis. If symbolic bound has a constant value, that value is the new lower bound. In case of a range expression, the lowerbound of the range is conservatively used as the lowerbound for the loop. If the symbolic value has an indeterminate value, the minimum possible value for Long is assigned to the lower bound

Parameters:
loop - the loop whose symbolic lower bound is to be replaced
Returns:
the expression for the new lowerbound with constant value

replaceSymbolicUpperBound

public static Expression replaceSymbolicUpperBound(Loop loop,
                                                   RangeDomain loop_rd)
Replaces symbolic values in loop upper bound with information obtained from range analysis. If symbolic bound has a constant value, that value is the new upper bound. In case of a range expression, the upperbound of the range is conservatively used as the upperbound for the loop. If the symbolic value has an indeterminate value, the maximum possible value for Long is assigned to the upper bound

Parameters:
loop - the loop whose symbolic upper bound is to be replaced
loop_rd - the range domain representing ranges for all vars in the loop statement
Returns:
the expression for the new upperbound with constant value

replaceSymbolicUpperBound

public static Expression replaceSymbolicUpperBound(Loop loop)
Replaces symbolic values in loop upper bound with information obtained from range analysis. If symbolic bound has a constant value, that value is the new upper bound. In case of a range expression, the upperbound of the range is conservatively used as the upperbound for the loop. If the symbolic value has an indeterminate value, the maximum possible value for Long is assigned to the upper bound

Parameters:
loop - the loop whose symbolic upper bound is to be replaced
Returns:
the expression for the new upperbound with constant value

extractOutermostDependenceTestEligibleLoops

public static java.util.List<Loop> extractOutermostDependenceTestEligibleLoops(Traversable t)

getReuseDistance

public static long getReuseDistance(Loop loop,
                                    ArrayAccess e1,
                                    ArrayAccess e2)
A simple implementation based on the Euclidean GCD algorithm to calculate the distance in terms of loop iterations between subscripts of dependent arrays. Only handles single index variable subscripts that are affine expressions of that single loop index variable. Does not handle coupled subscripts

Parameters:
loop - the loop w.r.t which distance needs to be calculated
e1 - array access that is one end of the dependence
e2 - array access that is at the other end of the dependence

toControlString

public static java.lang.String toControlString(Loop loop)
Returns the control structure of the specified loop in string.

Parameters:
loop - the given loop.
Returns:
the string for the control structure.
